params: {address} _staker The address of staker to retrieve stake data from.
{uint256} _period The specific period to get the weight for.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params: {uint256} _index Array index of the stake to be removed.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params: {uint256} _periods An array of the new periods.

returns._0: {address} _address Address for the staker. When remove the stake the stake amount goes to this address.
returns._1: {address} _startBlock The block this stake started. Used for migrating existing stakes initially.
returns._2: {address} _reward The reward this stake has collected. Used for migrating existing stakes initially.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

distribute().notice: Returns true. Distribute the pot balance among stakers.

getStakeWeight(uint256).notice: Returns weight of specific period. Determines the importance of the period in distribution calculation.

getTotalReward().notice: Returns total reward of all the active stakes.

setPenalty(uint256).notice: Returns the new pot address. It can only be executed by the admin.

setPeriods(uint256[]).notice: Returns the new periods. Can only be executed by the admin.

setPotAddress(address).notice: Returns the new pot address. Can only be executed by the admin.

setStake(uint256,uint256,address,uint256.notice: Manually sets a stake for an address. This us used for initial stake migration and can only be used by admin within within 195000 blocks (~30 days) from contract creation. Returns stake data.
